ygData.msgSnippet: Right cause if the client controlled it totally (and I didn t want to bring this up and start another exploit thread but here goes anyhow) it would be possible
ygData.messageBody:
Right cause if the client controlled it totally (and I didn't want to bring
this up and start another exploit thread but here goes anyhow) it would be
possible to hack the client and make a drop without actually dropping the
object. that would give free duplication of objects as one got 'dropped'
into the server world while the other one remained on the cursor.

-----Original Message-----
From: Jeffrey Sue [mailto:jsue@...]
Sent: Friday, June 02, 2000 3:11 PM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: Re: RE:No Drop complexity was [eqbards] minotaur horn change?


At 08:55 PM 6/2/00 +0000, you wrote:
>But it is a client side issue... if the client is set to not drop,
>the command never gets sent to the server that something is being
>dropped. The client decides the action first.

i don't think it's that clear that the client decides the action. the
server
keeps track of all the locations of objects. the locations of objects
(other
characters and npcs) determines what function is called,
drop/trade/give/etc.
it would make much more sense to have the whole drop/trade/give/etc code
on the server side. in other words the client can just send a
mouse_click_happened
interrupt along with x/y/z coordinates of the mouse location in the window.
then the server decides what to do with it.
